definition: to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: He tore it up and rolled it into pipe spills.
sentences.chinese: 他把它撕碎，卷成了点板烟的纸捻儿。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that the Cavendish is facing a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 无可质疑地，板烟正面临真正的问题。

sentences.english: Many of the genes which could have saved the Cavendish may already have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 许多能够拯救板烟香蕉的基因已经没了。

sentences.english: However, the real problem lies with the Cavendish , say biologists.
sentences.chinese: 然而生物学家表示，真正的问题在板烟香蕉。

definition: pewter (alloy of tin 錫|锡, lead 鉛|铅 and other metals)
pot-scrubbing brush made of bamboo strips/basket (container) for chopsticks/variant of 筲[shao1]
erhua variant of 桌面[zhuo1 mian4]
to seal jars etc with mud, clay or lute/lute/luting
